snippet: Concern over the number of available units shrinking to a near record low was allayed by a robust level of transactions.
abstract: Manhattan real estate market in 2013 experienced its most vibrant springtime burst of activity since 2007, despite a continuing depletion of inventory in borough's apartment listings that left home buyers with the fewest available second-quarter listings in 13 years.
lead_paragraph: Concern over the number of available units shrinking to a near record low was allayed by a robust level of transactions.

headline.main: Manhattan Apartment Sales Increase Despite Reduced Inventory
headline.print_headline: Apartment Sales Increase Despite Reduced Inventory
